metadata.title: CVE-2021-47442 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NFC:digital: fix possible memory leak in digital_in_send_sdd_req() 'skb' isallocated in digital_in_send_sdd_req(), but not free whendigital_in_send_cmd() failed, which will cause memory leak. Fix it byfreeing 'skb' if digital_in_send_cmd() return failed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47442` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-azure - 4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1129.142~14.04.1').
